snippet: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan on Friday issued a subpoena for information relating to David Samson, then withdrew it — apparently to clear the way for a federal inquiry in New Jersey.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan withdraw subpoena issued to Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for records related to potential conflicts of interest involving its chairman, David Samson, close political ally of Gov Chris Christie; move is apparently made to clear the way for the investigation over George Washington Bridge lane closings to be pursued by federal prosecutors in New Jersey.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and KATE ZERNIKE

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan on Friday issued a subpoena for information relating to David Samson, then withdrew it — apparently to clear the way for a federal inquiry in New Jersey.

headline.main: U.S. Sought Port Authority Records Tied to Chairman
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Said to Have Sought Port Authority Records Tied to Chairman

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
